verses.verse: The word <S%H1697><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> which <S%H834><s%> came <S%H1961><s%> to Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> the prophet <S%H5030><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> the Gentiles; <S%H1471><s%>

Against Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> against <S%H5921><s%> the army <S%H2428><s%> of Pharaohnecho <S%H6549><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> which <S%H834><s%> was by the river <S%H5104><s%> Euphrates <S%H6578><s%> in Carchemish, <S%H3751><s%> which <S%H834><s%> Nebuchadrezzar <S%H5019><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%> smote <S%H5221><s%> in the fourth <S%H7243><s%> year <S%H8141><s%> of Jehoiakim <S%H3079><s%> the son <S%H1121><s%> of Josiah <S%H2977><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Judah. <S%H3063><s%>
Order <S%H6186><s%> you the buckler <S%H4043><s%> and shield, <S%H6793><s%> and draw near <S%H5066><s%> to battle. <S%H4421><s%>

Harness <S%H631><s%> the horses; <S%H5483><s%> and get <S%H5927><s%> up, you horsemen, <S%H6571><s%> and stand <S%H3320><s%> forth with your helmets; <S%H3553><s%> furbish <S%H4838><s%> the spears, <S%H7420><s%> and put <S%H3847><s%> on the brigandines. <S%H5630><s%>

Why <S%H4069><s%> have I seen <S%H7200><s%> them dismayed <S%H2844><s%> and turned <S%H5472><s%> away back? <S%H268><s%> and their mighty <S%H1368><s%> ones are beaten <S%H3807><s%> down, and are fled <S%H5127><s%> apace, and look <S%H6437><s%> not back: <S%H3437><s%> for fear <S%H4032><s%> was round <S%H5439><s%> about, said <S%H5002><s%> the LORD. <S%H3068><s%>

Let not the swift <S%H7031><s%> flee <S%H5127><s%> away, nor <S%H408><s%> the mighty <S%H1368><s%> man escape; <S%H4422><s%> they shall stumble, <S%H3782><s%> and fall <S%H5307><s%> toward the north <S%H6828><s%> by the river <S%H5104><s%> Euphrates. <S%H6578><s%>
Who <S%H4310><s%> is this <S%H2088><s%> that comes <S%H5927><s%> up as a flood, <S%H2975><s%> whose waters <S%H4325><s%> are moved <S%H1607><s%> as the rivers? <S%H5104><s%>

Egypt <S%H4714><s%> rises <S%H5927><s%> up like a flood, <S%H2975><s%> and his waters <S%H4325><s%> are moved <S%H1607><s%> like the rivers; <S%H5104><s%> and he said, <S%H559><s%> I will go <S%H5927><s%> up, and will cover <S%H3680><s%> the earth; <S%H776><s%> I will destroy <S%H6><s%> the city <S%H5892><s%> and the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> thereof.

Come <S%H5927><s%> up, you horses; <S%H5483><s%> and rage, <S%H1984><s%> you chariots; <S%H7393><s%> and let the mighty <S%H1368><s%> men come <S%H3318><s%> forth; <S%H3318><s%> the Ethiopians <S%H3569><s%> and the Libyans, <S%H6316><s%> that handle <S%H8610><s%> the shield; <S%H4043><s%> and the Lydians, <S%H3866><s%> that handle <S%H8610><s%> and bend <S%H1869><s%> the bow. <S%H7198><s%>

For this <S%H1931><s%> is the day <S%H3117><s%> of the Lord <S%H136><s%> GOD <S%H3069><s%> of hosts, <S%H6635><s%> a day <S%H3117><s%> of vengeance, <S%H5360><s%> that he may avenge <S%H5358><s%> him of his adversaries: <S%H6862><s%> and the sword <S%H2719><s%> shall devour, <S%H398><s%> and it shall be satiate <S%H7646><s%> and made drunk <S%H7301><s%> with their blood: <S%H1818><s%> for the Lord <S%H136><s%> GOD <S%H3069><s%> of hosts <S%H6635><s%> has a sacrifice <S%H2077><s%> in the north <S%H6828><s%> country <S%H776><s%> by the river <S%H5104><s%> Euphrates. <S%H6578><s%>

Go <S%H5927><s%> up into Gilead, <S%H1568><s%> and take <S%H3947><s%> balm, <S%H6875><s%> O virgin, <S%H1330><s%> the daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Egypt: <S%H4714><s%> in vain <S%H7723><s%> shall you use many <S%H7235><s%> medicines; <S%H7499><s%> for you shall not be cured. <S%H8585><s%>

The nations <S%H1471><s%> have heard <S%H8085><s%> of your shame, <S%H7036><s%> and your cry <S%H6682><s%> has filled <S%H4390><s%> the land: <S%H776><s%> for the mighty <S%H1368><s%> man has stumbled <S%H3782><s%> against the mighty, <S%H1368><s%> and they are fallen <S%H5307><s%> both <S%H8147><s%> together. <S%H3162><s%>

The word <S%H1697><s%> that the LORD <S%H3068><s%> spoke <S%H1696><s%> to Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> the prophet, <S%H5030><s%> how Nebuchadrezzar <S%H5019><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon <S%H894><s%> should come <S%H935><s%> and smite <S%H5221><s%> the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt. <S%H4714><s%>

Declare <S%H5046><s%> you in Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> and publish <S%H8085><s%> in Migdol, <S%H4024><s%> and publish <S%H8085><s%> in Noph <S%H5297><s%> and in Tahpanhes: <S%H8471><s%> say <S%H559><s%> you, Stand <S%H3320><s%> fast, and prepare <S%H3559><s%> you; for the sword <S%H2719><s%> shall devour <S%H398><s%> round <S%H5439><s%> about you.
Why <S%H4069><s%> are your valiant <S%H47><s%> men swept <S%H5502><s%> away? they stood <S%H5975><s%> not, because <S%H3588><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> did drive <S%H1920><s%> them.

He made many <S%H7235><s%> to fall, <S%H3782><s%> yes, one <S%H376><s%> fell <S%H5307><s%> on another: <S%H7453><s%> and they said, <S%H559><s%> Arise, <S%H6965><s%> and let us go <S%H7725><s%> again <S%H7725><s%> to our own people, <S%H5971><s%> and to the land <S%H776><s%> of our nativity, <S%H4138><s%> from the oppressing <S%H3238><s%> sword. <S%H2719><s%>

They did cry <S%H7121><s%> there, <S%H8033><s%> Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> is but a noise; <S%H7588><s%> he has passed <S%H5674><s%> the time appointed. <S%H4150><s%>

As I live, <S%H2416><s%> said <S%H5002><s%> the King, <S%H4428><s%> whose name <S%H8034><s%> is the LORD <S%H3068><s%> of hosts, <S%H6635><s%> Surely <S%H3588><s%> as Tabor <S%H8396><s%> is among the mountains, <S%H2022><s%> and as Carmel <S%H3760><s%> by the sea, <S%H3220><s%> so shall he come. <S%H935><s%>

O you daughter <S%H1323><s%> dwelling <S%H3427><s%> in Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> furnish <S%H6213><s%> <S%H3627><s%> yourself to go into captivity: <S%H1473><s%> for Noph <S%H5297><s%> shall be waste <S%H8047><s%> and desolate <S%H3341><s%> without <S%H369><s%> an inhabitant. <S%H3427><s%>
Egypt <S%H4714><s%> is like a very <S%H3304><s%> fair <S%H3304><s%> heifer, <S%H5697><s%> but destruction <S%H7171><s%> comes; <S%H935><s%> it comes <S%H935><s%> out of the north. <S%H6828><s%>

Also <S%H1571><s%> her hired <S%H7916><s%> men are in the middle <S%H7130><s%> of her like fatted <S%H4770><s%> bullocks; <S%H5695><s%> for they also <S%H1571><s%> are turned <S%H6437><s%> back, <S%H3437><s%> and are fled <S%H5127><s%> away together: <S%H3162><s%> they did not stand, <S%H5975><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> the day <S%H3117><s%> of their calamity <S%H343><s%> was come <S%H935><s%> on them, and the time <S%H6256><s%> of their visitation. <S%H6486><s%>

The voice <S%H6963><s%> thereof shall go <S%H3212><s%> like a serpent; <S%H5175><s%> for they shall march <S%H3212><s%> with an army, <S%H2428><s%> and come <S%H935><s%> against her with axes, <S%H7134><s%> as hewers <S%H2404><s%> of wood. <S%H6086><s%>

They shall cut <S%H3772><s%> down her forest, <S%H3293><s%> said <S%H5002><s%> the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> though <S%H3588><s%> it cannot <S%H3808><s%> be searched; <S%H2713><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> they are more <S%H7231><s%> than the grasshoppers, <S%H697><s%> and are innumerable. <S%H369><s%> <S%H4557><s%>

The daughter <S%H1323><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%> shall be confounded; <S%H3001><s%> she shall be delivered <S%H5414><s%> into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the people <S%H5971><s%> of the north. <S%H6828><s%>

The LORD <S%H3068><s%> of hosts, <S%H6635><s%> the God <S%H430><s%> of Israel, <S%H3478><s%> said; <S%H559><s%> Behold, <S%H2005><s%> I will punish <S%H6485><s%> the multitude <S%H527><s%> of No, <S%H4996><s%> and Pharaoh, <S%H6547><s%> and Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> with their gods, <S%H430><s%> and their kings; <S%H4428><s%> even Pharaoh, <S%H6547><s%> and all them that trust <S%H982><s%> in him:

And I will deliver <S%H5414><s%> them into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of those that seek <S%H1245><s%> their lives, <S%H5315><s%> and into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of Nebuchadrezzar <S%H5019><s%> king <S%H4428><s%> of Babylon, <S%H894><s%> and into the hand <S%H3027><s%> of his servants: <S%H5650><s%> and afterward <S%H310><s%> <S%H3651><s%> it shall be inhabited, <S%H7931><s%> as in the days <S%H3117><s%> of old, <S%H6924><s%> said <S%H5002><s%> the LORD. <S%H3068><s%>

But fear <S%H3372><s%> not you, O my servant <S%H5650><s%> Jacob, <S%H3290><s%> and be not dismayed, <S%H2865><s%> O Israel: <S%H3478><s%> for, behold, <S%H2005><s%> I will save <S%H3467><s%> you from afar <S%H7350><s%> off, and your seed <S%H2233><s%> from the land <S%H776><s%> of their captivity; <S%H7633><s%> and Jacob <S%H3290><s%> shall return, <S%H7725><s%> and be in rest <S%H8252><s%> and at ease, <S%H7599><s%> and none <S%H369><s%> shall make him afraid. <S%H2729><s%>

Fear <S%H3372><s%> you not, O Jacob <S%H3290><s%> my servant, <S%H5650><s%> said <S%H5002><s%> the LORD: <S%H3068><s%> for I am with you; for I will make <S%H6213><s%> a full end <S%H3615><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> the nations <S%H1471><s%> where <S%H834><s%> <S%H8033><s%> I have driven <S%H5080><s%> you: but I will not make <S%H6213><s%> a full end <S%H3615><s%> of you, but correct <S%H3256><s%> you in measure; <S%H4941><s%> yet will I not leave you wholly <S%H5352><s%> unpunished. <S%H5352><s%>
